dns_goals.1-title: End poverty in all its forms everywhere
dns_goals.10-title: Reduce inequality within and among countries
dns_goals.11-title: Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable
dns_goals.12-title: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns
dns_goals.13-title: Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
dns_goals.14-title: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
dns_goals.15-title: Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation and halt biodiversity loss
dns_goals.16-title: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
dns_goals.17-title: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalise the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
dns_goals.2-title: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
dns_goals.3-title: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
dns_goals.4-title: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
dns_goals.5-title: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
dns_goals.6-title: Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
dns_goals.7-title: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
dns_goals.8-title: Promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
dns_goals.9-title: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialisation and foster innovation

dns_ranges.17.2-title: Knowledge transfer, especially in technical areas

dns_targets.10.1.1-title: Improving educational success of foreigners in German schools
dns_targets.12.1.1-title: Making consumption environmentally and socially compatible
dns_targets.12.2.1-title: Increasing the proportion of sustainable production continuously
dns_targets.12.3.1-title: Giving shape to the public sector’s exemplary role in sustainable procurement
dns_targets.13.1.2-title: Germany's contribution to international climate finance
dns_targets.14.1.1-title: Protecting and sustainably using oceans and marine resources
dns_targets.15.2.1-title: Protecting ecosystems, conserving ecosystem services and preserving habitats
dns_targets.15.2.2-title: Preventing deforestation and protecting soils world-wide
dns_targets.16.2.1-title: Taking practical action to combat proliferation, especially of small arms
dns_targets.17.3.1-title: Improving trade opportunities for developing countries
dns_targets.2.1.1-title: Environmentally sound production in our cultivated landscapes
dns_targets.2.2.1-title: Realising globally the right to food
dns_targets.4.1.1-title: Continuously improving education and vocational training
dns_targets.4.2.1-title: Improving the compatibility of work and family life
dns_targets.5.1.2-title: Strengthening the economic participation of women globally
dns_targets.6.1.1-title: Reducing the pollution of water with substances
dns_targets.6.2.1-title: Better access to drinking water and sanitation worldwide, higher (safer) quality
dns_targets.8.2.1-title: Consolidating public finances – Creating intergenerational equity
dns_targets.8.3.1-title: Creating favourable investment conditions – Securing long-term prosperity
dns_targets.8.4.1-title: Combining greater economic output with environmental and social responsibility
dns_targets.9.1.1-title: Shaping the future with new solutions

frontpage.heading: Indicators of the German Sustainable Development Strategy
frontpage.instructions: Click on each goal, for German statistics for Sustainable Development Goal indicators.
frontpage.instructions_dns: Click on each goal, or %before_link search %after_link for the German Sustainable Development Strategy indicator data.
frontpage.joint_action_text: The Federal Statistical Office is part of the Joint Action for Sustainable Development, an open platform for all those who are committed to a sustainable society.
frontpage.link_18_title: Click here to get to the DESTATIS page about the German Sustainable Development Strategy
frontpage.strategy_text: Information on the "German Sustainable Development Strategy" can be found here.

general.title_dns: Indicators on the German Sustainable Development Strategy

header.additional_information_blurb: The time series below consists of ranges of numbers instead of individual values. For technical reasons, the presentation in the form of interactive charts and tables is only possible for time series with purely numerical values, therefore the time series is presented here in PDF format.
header.data_not_available: No data available for this selection of sub-categories and units
header.dataset_size_warning: There are too many datasets to show on the chart. Not all will be shown until you remove some selections.
header.dns_metadata_blurb: This table includes additional information to the above visualized indicators, <abbr title="that is to say (id est)">i.e.</abbr> a short definition of this indicator and a description of the politically determined target values as well as explaining the political intention behind selecting this indicator.
header.global_metadata_blurb: This table provides information on metadata for SDG indicators. Global metadata is provided by the UN Statistics Division.
header.history_blurb: The synoptic table provides information about the evaluation of the indicator in previous years. It shows if the weather symbol assigned to an indicator was rather stable or volatile in the past years. (Evaluation of the Indicator Report 2022 )
header.legend_help: Click on the legend to remove individual lines from the chart.
header.national_metadata_blurb:
The international organisations (custodian agencies) that are responsible for the respective SDG-indicator publish methodological guidelines for the calculation of the indicator - so-called global metadata.

Displayed here are the national time series that fit the global metadata best as well as their comparability to the global metadata. Please find further methodical and country-specific information of the time series in the related national metadata sheet.
header.no_data_hint: No options available because of filters above
header.no_selection: No disaggregations are available for this indicator
header.series_help: Select here what should be displayed in the chart and in the table.
header.series_help_dns: Select here what should be displayed in the chart and in the table.
header.special_eval: Special evaluation based on data from the following
header.special_eval_plural: Special evaluation based on data from the following

paststatuses.1-1-ab_1_target: Keep the proportion of persons who are materially deprived considerably below the EU-28 level by 2030
paststatuses.1-1-ab_2_target: Keep the proportion of persons who are severely materially deprived considerably below the EU-28 level by 2030
paststatuses.10-1-a_1_target: Increase the proportion of foreign school leavers with a least a secondary general school certificate and bring into line with that of German school leavers by 2030
paststatuses.10-2-a_1: 10.2 - Gini coefficient of income after social transfers
paststatuses.10-2-a_1_target: Gini coefficient of income after social transfers to be below the EU28 figure by 2030
paststatuses.11-1-a_1: 11.1.a - Expansion of settlement and transport area in ha per day
paststatuses.11-1-a_1_target: Reduction to under 30 ha on average per day by 2030
paststatuses.11-1-b_1_target: Reduce the loss of per capita open space area
paststatuses.11-1-c_1_target: No reduction in density of settlements
paststatuses.11-2-a_1: 11.2.a - Final energy consumption in goods transport
paststatuses.11-2-b_1: 11.2.b - Final energy consumption in passenger transport
paststatuses.11-2-c_1: 11.2.c - Accessibility of medium-sized and large cities by public transport
paststatuses.11-2-c_1_target: Reduction of average travel time by public transport
paststatuses.11-3-a_1_target: Reduce the proportion of people who are overburdened to 13% by 2030
paststatuses.11-4-a_1: 11.4 - Number of objects in the German Digital Library
paststatuses.11-4-a_1_target: Increase in the number of objects in the network of the German Digital Library to 50 million by 2030
paststatuses.12-1-a_1: 12.1.a - Market share of products certified by publicly managed eco-labelling schemes (in future: market share of products and services bearing trustworthy and demanding eco- and social labels)
paststatuses.12-1-a_1_target: Increase the market share to 34% by 2030
paststatuses.12-1-b_1: 12.1.ba - Global environmental impact by private household consumption – use of raw materials
paststatuses.12-1-b_2: 12.1.bb - Global environmental impact by private household consumption – energy consumption
paststatuses.12-1-b_3: 12.1.bc - Global environmental impact by private household consumption – CO<sub>2</sub> emissions
paststatuses.12-3-ab_1: 12.3.a - Paper bearing the Blue Angel label as a proportion of the total paper consumption of the direct federal administration
paststatuses.12-3-ab_2: 12.3.b - CO<sub>2</sub> emissions of commercially available vehicles in the public sector
paststatuses.13-1-a_1_target: Reduce by at least 40% by 2020 and by at least 55% by 2030, in each case compared to 1990; greenhouse gas neutrality to be achieved by 2050
paststatuses.13-1-b_1: 13.1.b - International climate finance for the reduction of greenhouse gases and adaptation to climate change
paststatuses.14-1-a_1: 14.1.aa - Nitrogen input in coastal and marine waters – nitrogen input via the inflows into the Baltic Sea
paststatuses.14-1-a_1_target: Adherence to good quality in accordance with the Ordinance on the Protection of Surface Waters (Oberflächengewässerver-ordnung) (annual averages for total nitro-gen in rivers flowing into the Baltic may not exceed 2.6 mg/l)
paststatuses.14-1-a_2: 14.1.ab - Nitrogen input in coastal and marine waters – nitrogen input via the inflows into the North Sea
paststatuses.14-1-a_2_target: Adherence to good quality in accordance with the Ordinance on the Protection of Surface Waters (annual averages for total nitrogen in rivers flowing into the North Sea may not exceed 2.8 mg/l)
paststatuses.14-1-b_1: 14.1.b - Share of sustainably fished fish populations in the North Sea and Baltic
paststatuses.14-1-b_1_target: All fish stocks used for commercial purpos-es to be sustainably managed in accordance with the Maximum Sustainable Yield (MSY) approach by 2020
paststatuses.15-1-a_1_target: Reach the index value of 100 by 2030
paststatuses.15-3-ab_1: 15.3.a - Preservation or restoration of forests in developing countries under the REDD+ rulebook
paststatuses.15-3-ab_2: 15.3.b - German gross bilateral development expenditure for the implementation of the UN Convention to Combat Desertification
paststatuses.16-1-a_1_target: Reduce the number of criminal offences re-corded per 100,000 inhabitants to less than 6,500 by 2030
paststatuses.16-2-a_1: 16.2 - Number of projects to secure, register and destroy small arms and light weapons carried out by Germany in affected regions of the world
paststatuses.16-2-a_1_target: At least 15 projects per year by 2030
paststatuses.16-3-ab_2: 16.3.b - Corruption Perceptions Index in partner countries of German development cooperation
paststatuses.17-1-a_1: 17.1 - Official development assistance as a proportion of gross national income
paststatuses.17-1-a_1_target: Increase the proportion to 0.7% of gross national income by 2030
paststatuses.17-2-a_1: 17.2 - Number of students and researchers from developing countries and LDCs per year
paststatuses.17-2-a_1_target: Increase the number by 10% from 2015 to 2020, then stabilised
paststatuses.17-3-a_1_target: Increase the proportion by 100 % by 2030, compared to 2014
paststatuses.2-1-a_1_target: Reduction of the nitrogen surpluses of the overall balance for Germany to 70 kilo-grams per hectare of utilised agricultural area on an annual average between 2028 and 2032
paststatuses.2-1-b_1_target: Increase the proportion of organically farmed agricultural land to 20% by 2030
paststatuses.2-2-a_1: 2.2 - Support for good governance in attaining appropriate nutrition world-wide
paststatuses.2-2-a_1_target: Funds disbursed for the application of the guidelines and recommendations of the UN Committee on World Food Security (CFS) to be increased appropriately as a percentage of total spending on food security by 2030
paststatuses.3-1-ab_1_target: To be reduced to 100 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants (women) by 2030
paststatuses.3-1-ab_2_target: To be reduced to 190 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants (men) by 2030
paststatuses.3-1-e_1: 3.1.e - Obesity rate among children and adolescents
paststatuses.3-2-a_1_target: Reduction of emissions to 55% of 2005 level (unweighted average of the five pollutants) by 2030
paststatuses.3-2-b_1: 3.2.b - Share of the population with excessive exposure to PM<sub>10</sub>
paststatuses.3-2-b_1_target: WHO particulate matter guideline value of 20 micrograms/cubic metre for PM<sub>10</sub> to be adhered to as widely as possible by 2030
paststatuses.3-3-a_1: 3.3 - Germany’s contribu-tion to global pandemic prevention and response
paststatuses.4-1-b_1: 4.1.b - Persons with an academic or higher vocational qualification (30 to 34-year-olds with a tertiary or post-secondary non-tertiary level of education)
paststatuses.4-2-ab_1: 4.2.a - All-day care provision for 0 to 2-year-old children
paststatuses.4-2-ab_2: 4.2.b - All-day care provision for 3 to 5-year-old children
paststatuses.4-2-ab_2_target: Increase to 60% by 2020 and to 70% by 2030
paststatuses.5-1-a_1_target: Reduce the gap to 10% by 2020, maintained until 2030
paststatuses.5-1-bc_1: 5.1.b - Women in management positions in business
paststatuses.5-1-bc_1_target: 30% women on supervisory boards of listed and fully co-determined companies by 2030
paststatuses.5-1-bc_2: 5.1.c - Women in management positions in the federal civil service
paststatuses.5-1-bc_2_target: Equal-opportunity participation of women and men in civil service management posi-tions by 2025
paststatuses.5-1-d_1: 5.1.d - Proportion of fathers receiving parental allowance
paststatuses.5-1-e_1: 5.1.e - Vocational qualifications of women and girls through German development cooperation
paststatuses.5-1-e_1_target: To be increased gradually by a third by 2030 compared to 2015 as the base year
paststatuses.6-1-a_1_target: Not exceeding benchmark values for specific types of water bodies at all monitoring points by 2030
paststatuses.6-1-b_1_target: Compliance with the nitrate threshold value of 50 mg/l at all monitoring points by 2030
paststatuses.6-2-ab_1: 6.2.a - Number of people gaining first-time or upgraded access to drinking water owing to German support
paststatuses.6-2-ab_2: 6.2.b - Number of people gaining first-time or improved access to sanitation owing to German support
paststatuses.7-1-ab_1_target: Increase by 2.1% per year from 2008 to 2050
paststatuses.7-1-ab_2_target: Reduction by 20% by 2020, by 30% by 2030, and by 50% by 2050, all compared to 2008
paststatuses.7-2-a_1: 7.2.a - Share of renewable energies in gross final energy consumption
paststatuses.7-2-a_1_target: Increase to 18% by 2020 and to 30% by 2030, to 45% by 2040 and to 60% by 2050
paststatuses.7-2-b_1: 7.2.b - Share of electricity from renewable energy sources in gross electricity consumption
paststatuses.7-2-b_1_target: Increase to at least 35% by 2020, 65% by 2030, and greenhouse gas neutrality of electricity generated and consumed in Germa-ny by 2050
paststatuses.8-1-a_1_target: Trend of the years 2000–2010 to be maintained until 2030
paststatuses.8-2-ab_1_target: Annual government deficit less than 3% of GDP, to be maintained until 2030
paststatuses.8-2-ab_2_target: Structurally balanced government budget, general government structural deficit must not exceed 0.5% of GDP, to be maintained until 2030
paststatuses.8-2-c_1_target: Ratio of government debt to GDP must not exceed  60%, to be maintained until 2030
paststatuses.8-3-a_1: 8.3 - Gross fixed capital formation in relation to GDP
paststatuses.8-3-a_1_target: Appropriate development of the ratio, to be maintained until 2030
paststatuses.9-1-a_1: 9.1.a - Private and public expenditure on research and development
paststatuses.9-1-a_1_target: At least 3.5% of GDP per year by 2025
paststatuses.9-1-b_1: 9.1.b - Roll-out of broadband – share of households with access to gigabit broadband services

post.view_all_in_category: View all posts in the %category_name category

status.blitz: The indicator is not moving in the right direction so that the gap to the target value is widening
status.leicht bew\u00f6lkt: If the trend continues, the indicator will be presumably miss its target by at least 5 % and at most 20&nbsp% of the difference between the target value and the current value
status.sonne: If the trend continues, the target value will be met or the difference between the target value and the current value will be less than 5 %
status.wolke: The indicator is moving in the right direction but if the trend continues, the target value will be missed by more than 20 % in the target year

summary.14-1-a_2_target: Adherence to good quality in accordance with the Ordinance on the Protection of Surface Waters (annual averages for total nitrogen in rivers flowing into the North Sea may not exceed 2.8 mg/l)
summary.14-1-b_1: 14.1.b - Share of sustainably fished fish populations in the North Sea and Baltic
summary.14-1-b_1_target: All fish stocks used for commercial purpos-es to be sustainably managed in accordance with the Maximum Sustainable Yield (MSY) approach by 2020
summary.15-1-a_1_target: Reach the index value of 100 by 2030
summary.15-3-ab_1: 15.3.a - Preservation or restoration of forests in developing countries under the REDD+ rulebook
summary.15-3-ab_2: 15.3.b - German gross bilateral development expenditure for the implementation of the UN Convention to Combat Desertification
summary.16-1-a_1_target: Reduce the number of criminal offences re-corded per 100,000 inhabitants to less than 6,500 by 2030
summary.16-2-a_1: 16.2 - Number of projects to secure, register and destroy small arms and light weapons carried out by Germany in affected regions of the world
summary.16-2-a_1_target: At least 15 projects per year by 2030
summary.16-3-ab_2: 16.3.b - Corruption Perceptions Index in partner countries of German development cooperation
summary.17-1-a_1: 17.1 - Official development assistance as a proportion of gross national income
summary.17-1-a_1_target: Increase the proportion to 0.7% of gross national income by 2030
summary.17-2-a_1: 17.2 - Number of students and researchers from developing countries and LDCs per year
summary.17-2-a_1_target: Increase the number by 10% from 2015 to 2020, then stabilised
summary.17-3-a_1_target: Increase the proportion by 100 % by 2030, compared to 2014
summary.2-1-a_1_target: Reduction of the nitrogen surpluses of the overall balance for Germany to 70 kilo-grams per hectare of utilised agricultural area on an annual average between 2028 and 2032
summary.2-1-b_1_target: Increase the proportion of organically farmed agricultural land to 20% by 2030
summary.2-2-a_1: 2.2 - Support for good governance in attaining appropriate nutrition world-wide
summary.2-2-a_1_target: Funds disbursed for the application of the guidelines and recommendations of the UN Committee on World Food Security (CFS) to be increased appropriately as a percentage of total spending on food security by 2030
summary.3-1-ab_1_target: To be reduced to 100 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants (women) by 2030
summary.3-1-ab_2_target: To be reduced to 190 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants (men) by 2030
summary.3-1-e_1: 3.1.e - Obesity rate among children and adolescents
summary.3-2-a_1_target: Reduction of emissions to 55% of 2005 level (unweighted average of the five pollutants) by 2030
summary.3-2-b_1: 3.2.b - Share of the population with excessive exposure to PM10
summary.3-2-b_1_target: WHO particulate matter guideline value of 20 micrograms/cubic metre for PM10 to be adhered to as widely as possible by 2030
summary.3-3-a_1: 3.3 - Germany’s contribution to global pandemic prevention and response
summary.4-1-b_1: 4.1.b - Persons with an academic or higher vocational qualification (30 to 34-year-olds with a tertiary or post-secondary non-tertiary level of education)
summary.4-2-ab_1: 4.2.a - All-day care provision for 0 to 2-year-old children
summary.4-2-ab_2: 4.2.b - All-day care provision for 3 to 5-year-old children
summary.4-2-ab_2_target: Increase to 60% by 2020 and to 70% by 2030
summary.5-1-a_1_target: Reduce the gap to 10% by 2020, maintained until 2030
summary.5-1-bc_1: 5.1.b - Women in management positions in business
summary.5-1-bc_1_target: 30% women on supervisory boards of listed and fully co-determined companies by 2030
summary.5-1-bc_2: 5.1.c - Women in management positions in the federal civil service
summary.5-1-bc_2_target: Equal-opportunity participation of women and men in civil service management positions by 2025
summary.5-1-d_1: 5.1.d - Proportion of fathers receiving parental allowance
summary.5-1-e_1: 5.1.e - Vocational qualifications of women and girls through German development cooperation
summary.5-1-e_1_target: To be increased gradually by a third by 2030 compared to 2015 as the base year
summary.6-1-a_1_target: Not exceeding benchmark values for specific types of water bodies at all monitoring points by 2030
summary.6-1-b_1_target: Compliance with the nitrate threshold value of 50 mg/l at all monitoring points by 2030
summary.6-2-ab_1: 6.2.a - Number of people gaining first-time or upgraded access to drinking water owing to German support
summary.6-2-ab_2: 6.2.b - Number of people gaining first-time or improved access to sanitation owing to German support
summary.7-1-ab_1_target: Increase by 2.1% per year from 2008 to 2050
summary.7-1-ab_2_target: Reduction by 20% by 2020, by 30% by 2030, and by 50% by 2050, all compared to 2008
summary.7-2-a_1: 7.2.a - Share of renewable energies in gross final energy consumption
summary.7-2-a_1_target: Increase to 18% by 2020 and to 30% by 2030, to 45% by 2040 and to 60% by 2050
summary.7-2-b_1: 7.2.b - Share of electricity from renewable energy sources in gross electricity consumption
summary.7-2-b_1_target: Increase to at least 35% by 2020, 65% by 2030, and greenhouse gas neutrality of electricity generated and consumed in Germany by 2050
summary.8-1-a_1_target: Trend of the years 2000–2010 to be maintained until 2030
summary.8-2-ab_1_target: Annual government deficit less than 3% of GDP, to be maintained until 2030
summary.8-2-ab_2_target: Structurally balanced government budget, general government structural deficit must not exceed 0.5% of GDP, to be maintained until 2030
summary.8-2-c_1_target: Ratio of government debt to GDP must not exceed  60%, to be maintained until 2030
summary.8-3-a_1: 8.3 - Gross fixed capital formation in relation to GDP
summary.8-3-a_1_target: Appropriate development of the ratio, to be maintained until 2030
summary.9-1-a_1: 9.1.a - Private and public expenditure on research and development
summary.9-1-a_1_target: At least 3.5% of GDP per year by 2025
summary.9-1-b_1: 9.1.b - Roll-out of broadband – share of households with access to gigabit broadband services

weather.assessment_later: Assessment will be carried out later
weather.overview_blurb:
In the overview table, the ratings of the indicators are given according to the status of the previous years. This shows whether the weather symbol for an indicator has been stable or rather volatile in the past years.
The basis for the assessments presented here is the data as published in the 2022 indicator report. The data on this platform is updated regularly, so that more current data may be available online than published in the indicator report.

Indicators with multiple targets
For indicators with multiple targets to be met over time (e.g., indicator 7.1.b), the ratings for meeting each target are provided. The same applies to indicators with multiple targets to be met simultaneously (e.g., indicator 10.1).

Indicators with target changes
In addition to the currently valid goals of the federal government, the goals are presented that were valid in the past but have been changed in the meantime.

In grayed out form, all weather icons are displayed for destinations that are currently not valid, because
• the target has been changed in the past,
• a goal closer in time must be fulfilled first, or
• the target is only one of several targets to be fulfilled at the same time.
